title: Personal Website with Resume, Blogs, Memories, Articles, and Kids' Study Material

requirements.text: Create a warm, personal, and elegant visual theme for the entire website — using earthy, cozy tones (e.g., warm beige, deep forest green, soft terracotta) with clean serif/sans-serif typography and a layout that feels like a personal journal or digital home. Apply this theme consistently across all pages and sections.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette of warm, earthy tones is applied site-wide.
Typography uses a readable, warm font pairing for headings and body text.
Layout feels personal and inviting, not corporate.

requirements.text: Build a homepage with a hero section introducing the owner, a navigation bar linking to all major sections (Resume, Blogs, Memories, Articles, Kids' Study Material), and a brief summary of what the site offers.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays owner's name and a short personal bio.
Navigation bar has links to all five sections.
Homepage gives a clear overview of the site's purpose.

requirements.text: Implement a Resume section that displays structured professional information including a summary/about section, work experience timeline, education, and skills. Store and serve resume data from the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Resume page renders work experience entries in chronological order.
Skills and education are clearly displayed.
Resume data is stored in the backend and fetched on load.

requirements.text: Implement a Blog section where the owner can create, store, and display blog posts. Each post should have a title, content body, publication date, and optional tags. The blog listing page shows all posts as cards; clicking a card opens the full post.
acceptanceCriteria: Blog listing page shows all posts as summary cards with title, date, and tags.
Clicking a blog card navigates to the full blog post page.
Blog posts are persisted in the backend.
An admin form allows creating new blog posts.

requirements.text: Implement a Memories section for storing and displaying personal photo memories. Each memory entry has a title, description, and an image URL. Display memories in a masonry-style or grid gallery layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Memories are displayed in a visually appealing grid or masonry layout.
Each memory card shows an image, title, and description.
Memory entries are stored in and fetched from the backend.
An admin form allows adding new memory entries.

requirements.text: Implement an Articles section for publishing long-form articles. Each article has a title, rich text content, publication date, and an optional cover image URL. The listing page shows article cards; clicking opens the full article.
acceptanceCriteria: Articles listing page shows all articles as cards with title, date, and excerpt.
Full article view renders the complete content.
Articles are persisted in the backend.
An admin form allows creating new articles.

requirements.text: Implement a Kids' Study Material section for hosting educational content created for children. Each item has a title, subject/category, description, and a content body or downloadable link. Items are displayed in a friendly, colorful grid organized by subject.
acceptanceCriteria: Study material is organized and filterable by subject/category.
Each item card shows title, subject, and description.
Study material entries are persisted in the backend.
An admin form allows adding new study material items.
The section uses a slightly more playful, child-friendly visual style within the overall theme.

requirements.text: Add a simple admin mode (toggle or password-protected panel) that reveals 'Add New' forms for each section (Blog, Memories, Articles, Study Material, Resume). This allows the owner to manage content directly from the site without a separate CMS.
acceptanceCriteria: A single admin toggle or simple PIN entry reveals content management forms.
Each section has a corresponding form to add/edit entries.
Admin mode is hidden from regular visitors.

requirements.text: Generate a warm, illustrative hero background image for the homepage featuring soft botanical/nature elements (leaves, soft light) in earthy tones to reinforce the personal and welcoming feel of the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section uses the generated background image.
Image is served from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Image complements the warm earthy color palette.

constraints: All backend logic must remain in a single Motoko actor file (backend/main.mo).
Do not edit any files listed under frontend.immutablePaths.
Generated images must be served as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated — not routed through the backend.
nonGoals: User authentication or login for visitors (admin toggle is owner-only and client-side).
External file/image upload storage (use URLs for images).

required: Soft botanical hero background illustration with leaves, warm golden light rays, and gentle nature textures in earthy beige, forest green, and soft terracotta tones (hero-background.dim_1440x600.png)
